1.text: Then came to Jesus from Jerusalem the scribes and Pharisees, saying,

2.text: Wherefore do thy disciples pass by the tradition of the elders? for they wash not their hands when they eat bread.

3.text: And he, having answered, said to them, Wherefore do ye also pass by the command of God by your tradition.

4.text: For God commanded, saying, Honour thy father and mother: and, he calumniating father or mother, in death let him die.

5.text: And ye say, Whoever should say to father or mother, A gift, whatever thou shouldest be profited by me;

6.text: And should not honour his father or his mother. And ye have annulled the command of God by your tradition.

7.text: Hypocrites, well did Esaias prophesy of you, saying,

8.text: This people draw near me with their mouth, and honour me with their lips; but their heart keeps off far from me.

9.text: But they worship me in vain, teaching doctrines the commands of men.

10.text: And having called the crowd, he said to them, Hear ye, and understand.

11.text: Not that coming into the mouth pollutes the man; but that going forth out of the mouth, this pollutes the man.

12.text: Then his disciples having come near, said to him, Knowest thou that the Pharisees, having heard the word, were scandalized?

13.text: And having answered, he said, Every plant, which my heavenly Father has not planted, shall be rooted up.

14.text: Let them go: they are blind guides of the blind. And if the blind guide the blind, both shall fall into the ditch.

15.text: And Peter, having answered, said to him, Explain to us this parable.

16.text: And Jesus said, Are ye also yet destitute of understanding?

17.text: Do ye not yet understand, that everything going into the mouth proceeds to the belly, and is cast out in the privy?

18.text: But the things going forth out of the mouth come from the heart, and these pollute the man.

19.text: For from the heart come forth evil reflections, slaughters, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false testimonies, defamations:

20.text: These are the things polluting a man: but to eat with unwashed hands pollutes not a man.

21.text: And Jesus, having gone forth from thence, withdrew into the parts of Tyre and Sidon.

22.text: And, behold, a woman, a Canaanite, having come forth from those boundaries, cried out to him, saying, Pity me, Lord, son of David; my daughter is badly possessed with an evil spirit.

23.text: And he answered her not a word. And his disciples, having come, asked him, saying, Loose her; for she cries out after us.

24.text: And he, having answered, said, I was not sent except to the sheep having been lost, of the house of Israel.

25.text: And she, having come, worshipped him, saying, Lord, help me.

26.text: And he, having answered, said, It is not good to take the childrenâ€™s bread, and cast it to the little dogs.

27.text: And she said, Yes, Lord; for the little dogs also eat from the crumbs falling from the table of their lord.

28.text: Then Jesus, having answered, said to her, O woman, great thy faith: let it be to thee as thou wilt. And her daughter was healed from that hour.

29.text: And having passed from thence, Jesus came to the sea of Galilee; and having gone up into a mountain, he sat there.

30.text: And many crowds came to him, having with them the lame, blind, dumb, maimed, and many others, and they cast them at the feet of Jesus; and he cured them:

31.text: So that the crowds wondered, seeing the dumb speaking, the maimed sound, the lame walking, and the blind seeing: and they praised the God of Israel.

32.text: And Jesus having called his disciples, said, I feel compassion for the crowd, for already they remain with me three days, and they have nothing they could eat: and I will not leave them fasting, lest they be relaxed in the way.

33.text: And his disciples say to him, Whence to us, in a lonely place, so many loaves, to satisfy such a crowd?

34.text: And he says to them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven, and a few little fishes.

35.text: And he encouraged the crowd to recline upon the earth.

36.text: And having taken the seven loaves and the fishes, having returned thanks, he brake, and gave to his disciples, and the disciples to the crowd.

37.text: And all ate, and were satisfied: and they took up that remaining of the fragments seven wicker baskets full.

38.text: And they eating were four thousand men, besides women and children.

39.text: And having loosed the crowds, he went into a ship, and came into the bounds of Magdala.
